p: In a socioeconomic context, HDI data allows an ordering among municipalities and provides a means of determining the level of development of each region. In this study, the HDI was significant indicator of a greater chance of occurrence and intensity of influenza A (H1N1) transmission in more populous municipalities, that is, those with higher HDIs. Xiao et al. [ 35] analyzed the spatiotemporal spread of influenza A (H1N1) in Changsha, China in 2009 and the factors that influenced the diffusion process. They showed that the regions with the highest incidence rates were concentrated in more economically developed areas, such as cities and economic districts.
